description.narrative: By December 2016, 80% of municipalities from Semi-Arid, Amazon and of those with more than 150 thousand inhabitants strengthened capacity has increased to identify and locate girls and boys aged 4 to 17 who are out of school or in risk of dropping out, and to implement equity focused programmes to ensure the universalization of the right to quality education.

sector.narrative: Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs Technical staff services

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Brazil (Citizen engagement and participation)
UNICEF Programmes in Brazil (Policies Monitoring and Cooperations)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By December 2016, 80% of municipalities from Semi-Arid, Amazon and of those with more than 150 thousand inhabitants strengthened capacity has increased to identify and locate girls and boys aged 4 to 17 who are out of school or in risk of dropping out, and to implement equity focused programmes to ensure the universalization of the right to quality education.

description.narrative: UNICEF and partners developed a strategy on active search of out of school children and adolescents inspiring municipalities to work through an intersectoral manner to address school exclusion. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: % of municipalities taking part in the UNICEF Seal project in the SAB and Amazon regions and participating in the 8 Large Urban Centers trained with UNICEF's support, taking part in BPC Escola (Continuous Cash Benefit for Schools) system and developing actions to actively reach out disabled children and adolescents to include them in the school system.

baseline.value: For the SAB and Amazon regions and for 8 Large Urban Centers: As indicated in reports of the BPC Escola system (SECAD/MEC and MDS)

baseline.value: For the SAB and Amazon regions and for the Large Urban Centers: N/A.

baseline.value: For the SAB, Amazon region and Large Urban Centers: N/A (No ongoing actions for this purpose)

actual.value:
2016:SAB: 76% (867/1134)
Amazon Region: n/a (no ongoing actions for this purpose)

title.narrative: Existence of legislation on cash transfer programmes and/or family benefits

actual.value: 2016:Yes. Bolsa Família (cash transfer programme to poor families).

title.narrative: % of municipalities taking part in the UNICEF Seal project in the SAB and Amazon regions and participating in the 8 Large Urban Centers participated in capacity development activities (including face-to-face or virtual events) held with UNICEF's support to analyze the situation of girls and boys out of school and/or at risk of drop out and to develop action plans to address this issue.

actual.value:
2016:SAB: 72% (816)
Amazon region: 73% (215) - education plans, 65% (191) - active search.
